AllWisdom.wisdomAll:
When the first wisp of wind brushed across the land, birds that yearned for the sky had wings but no way to fly.
They asked the Anemo God:
"How can we reach the heavens?"
To which the Anemo God replied:
"You have yet to find that which is most important"
As the god spoke, the wind thrust the seeds of a dandelion high into the sky. The birds thrust out their wings but the breeze was all to mild.
Leaving them to stumble across the earth. So they went to the gorge where the wind showed off its wild and incomparable strength.
They threw themselves off the cliff and flapped their wings amongst the howling winds, until they where able to fly freely in the sky.
To the Anemo God they went, to gleefully say:
"We understand now! All we needed was a stronger wind to fly"
In reply the Anemo God said: "What you lacked was not wind, but courage. It is courage that has allowed you to become the first flying birds of this world."
